scenario_text.value: Takuma, Agumon! Welcome back!

Saki told me how the mountains are covered in
fog.

It’s not just the mountains. There’s fog
appearing elsewhere, too.

About the only places that are still safe are
this school and the shrines.

Then if Kaito’s safe, he must be somewhere
nearby.
That’s true. I’m starting to have some hope!

If we keep searching, at this rate we’ll find
’em both before too long.

(That’s odd. They seem so happy. Not scared
at all...)

(Even though danger could be lurking around
any turn, ready to jump out.)

(They must be pretending to be okay to make
the rest of us feel better... Is that it?)
(What should I make of Saki’s attitude?)
She’s not scared.
She’s striking a balance.
She’s being careless.
She’s not scared.

I’m glad you’re staying positive, but I think
we should be a little more concerned.
The fog is dangerous. I get it.

But we decided to look for Kaito before we
save Miyuki, right?

I just want to do that as fast as possible,
if that’s still our plan.
I can certainly understand that.

But the situation has gotten worse. We need
to rethink our plan.
Erm...
It’s an act.

(There’s no way she doesn’t understand the
danger. She just doesn’t want to say it.)

(She’s being positive to balance out the
professor’s more hard-line approach.)

(In that case it’s actually impressive how
she’s managing the group energy.)

I see what you’re saying, Saki... But don’t
get too overjoyed about it.
She’s careless.

I see what you’re saying, but I think it’s
scarier than that.
Why?

The fog might increase even more—then what
will we do?

It might suddenly spread like it did when
Miyuki was bound to the altar.

If that happens while we’re searching for
Kaito and we get trapped, then what?

Stop scaring me! I mean, we should think
about that, too...

But it makes me so scared I can’t keep up the
search for Kaito.
Saki...

I understand Saki’s feelings, but we must
keep the danger in mind.

The fog could envelop this area in the blink
of an eye.

We don’t know how long we have. We need to
change our approach.

We must be quick yet careful...and able to
flee at a moment’s notice.

It’d be dangerous to search for him without
settling on a firm approach first.

Then we should gather everyone who’s not here
and form a clear system for action.

Yeah. Let’s search the area and gather
everyone together.

Be careful, Takuma. And if you feel in
danger, come back quick!

It IS scary that the fog is spreading, but it
might make it easier to find Kaito!
